ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] How to filter out this crawler trap (Twiki documentation)
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Joe, I haven t tested this, but an approach that should work is filtering these out with a regular expression. Pause the crawler, then go to the job

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] How to filter out this crawler trap (Twiki
 documentation)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=325624130; y=JXGyQSj3dP36grAi2ghDMjXnmuzzWPcRkT4Xh4I3VW8Ea0U
X-Yahoo-Profile: nlevitt0

Hello Joe,

I haven't tested this, but an approach that should work is filtering these 
out with a regular expression. Pause the crawler, then go to the job 
configuration. On the Submodules page, add a MatchesRegExpDecideRule, call 
it rejectTwikiTrap. Then go to the Settings page, find rejectTwikiTrap, set 
the decision to REJECT, and set the regexp to 
^http://.*/Twiki/TwikiDocumentation\?cover=print&amp.*$ Click Finished, 
go to the console, and resume.

This looks like a Twiki bug, you may want to report it to them, though it 
might be known and even fixed in a later version.

Noah

joehung302 wrote:
> 1. Go to this page:
> http://wiki.vcsa.uci.edu/bin/view/Twiki/TwikiDocumentation?cover=print
> This is a legitimate Twiki documentation page.
> 
> 2. Find the word "Resource", you'll locate a table. Hit the "Resource" 
> header on that table. Note the URL for this link.
> 
> 3. Once the page loads, hit the "Resource" header link again. The same 
> documentation loads but it is a different URL. (Hence the trap).
> 
> Apparently our cralwer has stumbled on this for a good time. Since 
> Twiki is a well known software I'm worried if there are quite a few out 
> there. Is there a effective way to filter out this trap?
> 
> Cheers,
> -Joe
>
